description:
The tiny town of Ashford, Wyoming is the first place on Earth to replace its emergency service vehicles with autonomous counterparts.

God help us all.

9111 (Pronounced "Nine One-One-One") is a hectic racer and also city chaos simulator where the player takes control of the police force, the fire department, and the EMT force all at the same time. Keep the town safe, steady, and not burning for as long as possible.

Think playing through most SimCity disasters simultaneously with the mechanics of GTA 2 (but you're actually trying to save people).

[And hey, if you're having trouble, you can just go haywire and watch the simulation go wild! Chaos is fun!]

/// Controls ///

Arrow Keys/WASD: Drive

Your vehicles automatically resolve situations if they're in proximity:

Ambulance (Red): heals wounded peeps (wounded criminals become regular citizens after being treated).

Firetruck (Orange): puts out fires.

Police (Green): safely arrests criminals.

/// Credits ///

Game Design & Art - Idan Rooze

Code - Omer Zadok

Systems Design & Writing - DancingEngie

Music - Amit Katzengold

Vehicle sound effects adapted from ZapSplat under an attribution license

Created for the GMTK Game Jam 2021

[Note: "9111" is satirical and entirely fictional. Any resemblance between the events portrayed in its plot and real life is coincidental, and kinda frightening. We also have nothing against Wyoming.]
